name: EPIC 212424622
scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 212424622 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 212424622 is a star with 1.11 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.22 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 212424622 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 212424622 system


EPIC 212424622 b

EPIC 212424622 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 212424622 b is 5.3424 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 212424622 b is 2.17 that of Earth. At 5.3424 Earth masses, EPIC 212424622 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 212424622, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
